text: The mighty Zar of the Kul Tribe traverses the Nine Wastes eagerly searching for his next victim.
The warriors of the Kul Tribe are known for cutting out any tooth, bone or limb for their victims to carry as prizes.
The Kurgans of the Kul worship not only the Chaos Gods, but a variety of sinister lesser daemons - each with their own vile ambitions.
The Horn of the Kul is made out of twisted concrete metal, carrying it is a feat in it's own right.
Unusual amongst the hordes of Chaos are those who master the spear, the Kul however operate these long weapons if they were daggers.
For the Kul, Chaos Spawns are considered those worthy enough to have been touch by the Gods.
To recieve mutations is to have been deemed worthy in the eyes of the ever watching Chaos Gods.
The Kul Tribe are the most verocious of all the Northern Tribes, murdering and pillaging wherever they travel.
The Kurgan collect ancient runestones who have withstood men's mere existence. They are said to carry vile and chaotic magic.
No nay never will he play the reaving crow no more..

Amidst the desolation of the Eastern Steppes, Kurgan lord Akkorak the Crow wielded the Spear of the Wastes. Forged from the bones of ancient behemoths, its sharp tip sang the haunting melody of forgotten empires. As Akkorak charged, the spear cleaved through the air like the wings of carrion crows, rewriting the annals of the desolate steppes with each relentless strike. Legends spoke of the nomadic lord, a silhouette against the vast expanse, carrying the echoes of conquest on the Spear of the Wastes.
Arguably the most ruthless tribes amongst the Northern people, the Zar of the Kul must proof his standing by performing despicable acts.
The Spear of the Wastes has soaked the blood of warriors hailing from all Northern tribes.
